problems_extracted: Currently they have to click each one individually which is a problem for their workflow

problems_extracted: Zero visibility into workflow execution
Testing workflows triggers cascading side effects
Configuration takes 80+ hours per workflow
Noxin workflow builder creates bad CRM workflows
Property creation requires manual HubSpot work
Data quality failures are catastrophic
hypothesis_candidates: Bad data from automation causes churn faster than missing features
key_quotes: Bad data is worse than no data because you're gonna double down on the wrong decision
I have a workflow that I have eighty hours in
The experience of using it is painful

problems_extracted: AskElephant success depends on HubSpot configuration quality
Sales reps won't leave HubSpot to use AskElephant
Global Chat should be embedded in HubSpot as sidebar
Workflow builder has too many confusing legacy nodes
No visibility into what workflows are actually doing
Meeting prep takes too long - reps don't do it
CRM reporting doesn't answer 'so what?'
hypothesis_candidates: HubSpot sidebar integration for Global Chat
Proactive deal intelligence / AI sales manager
key_quotes: I would love a global chat to be a card or a on the record sidebar in HubSpot directly. I would use the fuck out of that.
Sales reps just wanna do whatever they're rogue cowboys want to do... Make money.
AskElephant is really only successful if you have the right bill or, like, data, right chart
I am convinced that [hidden auto-fill fields] is the best practice of the future

competitive_intel.fathom: Product sucks, no real CRM integration
competitive_intel.ebsta: Failed forecasting tool - bad data problem

signals.summary: Zipcio's 3-phase service methodology showing AskElephant positioned as Phase 3 (Revenue Intelligence) - introduced ONLY after HubSpot is properly configured in Phases 1-2
key_insights: AskElephant is Phase 3 of 3 - last step after CRM is clean
24+ hours of prerequisite work before AskElephant implementation
Success metrics: 80% calls scoring 7+, <10 violations per rep/week
deliverables_mentioned: Custom HubSpot properties for quali tracking

phase_1.name: Definition and Acquisition
phase_1.focus: ICP definition, Clay tables, lead enrichment

phase_3.name: Revenue Intelligence
phase_3.focus: AI Sales Manager, scoring rubrics, process rules

strategic_implications: Partners need 50+ hours of CRM work before AskElephant is viable
Clear success metrics partners track (call scores, violations)
Supered is complementary tool in partner stack

problems_extracted: Chat history lacks company/account context for navigation
No deal-centric workspace - must leave HubSpot to find context
HubSpot activities not stored locally - must fetch on demand
HubSpot agent behavior inconsistent
Workflow sidebar organization confusing
hypothesis_candidates: Solo rep persona needs self-coaching, not team monitoring
key_quotes: A pipeline view of mirroring my HubSpot pipeline into AskElephant for me to very quickly start to say, hey. Let me hop in on a per account basis or a per deal basis
I'm actually way more interested in coaching from the aspect of, like, cool. Pull out some the common questions that have been asked across all my transcripts
Can we add the context of either company or something to that just so that I have a bit of ability to delineate between them
action_items: Send structured outputs video to Jared - Tyler
Check Maple HubSpot agent setup with improvements - Skylar
Add company/account context to chat list - Product backlog

problems_extracted: Customer-facing diagnostic may threaten HubSpot partner business model
Auto-fix functionality crosses partner territory
Current positioning could damage partner relationships
key_quotes: If we make it super easy for us to simulate the fix and fix and go do that, then it comes up with a question of why is Crispy even needed?
I wanna make sure that we're not only stepping on toes, but crushing toes. That could burn potential partnerships in the future.
So what if instead, this is not check your HubSpot health. This is a tool only for partners, and it's part of our partner program.
We wanna give you more billable hours. We want to actually increase your top line.
They would want essentially that to be almost private. Creating that moat around their money making tool.
strategic_implications: Partner-first positioning may be optimal path
Diagnostic should enable partners, not replace them
Auto-fix feature is high-risk for partner relationships
action_items: Show prototype to James for additional input
Show prototype to Crispy directly - gauge reaction

decision_required.question: Should CRM Readiness Diagnostic be customer-facing, partner-only, or hybrid?
options: Hybrid (basic for customers, advanced for partners)

signals.summary: Figma Make prototype spec from Adam exploring chat interface patterns for agent interaction. Includes typewriter effects, sequential artifact reveal, and sticky input patterns.
design_patterns: Sequential message reveal with typewriter effect
Artifact chains that fade in after text completes
Sticky footer input card with auto-expanding textarea
ux_implications: Simulated AI thinking state builds trust
Secure connection indicator addresses trust concerns
open_questions: Does pattern apply to workflow builder node or standalone chat only?
Should Suggested Workflows map to Composio integrations?
How does Secure connection relate to OAuth flows?
signals.creator: Adam

signals.summary: Adam + Tyler walkthrough of Figma Make Options A/B/C. Key finding: conversational agent setup preferred over form fields. Critical problem identified: workspace vs user-level authentication for shared agents.
problems_extracted: Workspace vs user-level authentication conflict when agents are shared
Blank prompt fields intimidate users - no guidance
Non-deterministic output - customers want consistent formatting
Option C missing visibility settings (draft/shared/recommended)
feature_requests: Test agent before activating (hypothetical output preview)
Smart suggestions based on user context/call history
Automatic agent detection in chat (no explicit invocation)
design_decisions: Option B preferred over Option A (cleaner layout)
Option C best for conversational setup but needs visibility settings
Agents should auto-detect in chat, no @-mention needed
key_quotes: The agent is supposed to replace workflows... it's actually supposed to automate things in the background
People see this blank text field and they have no clue what to do
If we're combining the integration experience with the workflow experience into one experience, then we're presented with this really big problem
Unlike Pipedream where you have to toggle on your agents, you can actually just say [in chat]... and it should know which ones to use
You set up your agent in chat. It's like a conversation

action_items.what: Send conversational agent prototype to Tyler
Create v2 of Figma Make prototype

signals.summary: Deep architecture discussion clarifying Composio scope (toolbox only) vs skills, memory, sub-agents as separate layers. Key UX challenge: trigger/integration ordering creates chicken-and-egg problem.
problems_extracted: Integration/trigger ordering UX - users think trigger-first but system needs integration-first
Tool discovery at scale - Slack has 100+ tools, need search/filtering
First-time user context gap - can't show smart defaults without tech stack knowledge
Skills vs agents naming confusion - need clear mental model

key_concepts.composio: Toolbox only - integrations and tools, nothing more
key_concepts.skills: Reusable expertise prompts, auto-discoverable via progressive disclosure
key_concepts.sub_agents: Delegation to specialized agents for specific tasks

key_quotes: Composeo is literally just this box right here
Skills are literally just a massive, like it's a skill name, a description, and then instructions are, like, a massive prompt that teaches it how to be an expert in a specific topic
The more complex and better the skills get, the less instructions I need to give to the agent
Long term memory is, like, I have a conversation with the agent, and then I come back and I start a new conversation, and it remembers things from past conversations
feature_requests: Generic trigger categories (scheduled, on event) before integration picker
Progressive skill loading based on context
design_patterns: Progressive disclosure for skills (name/description always visible, details loaded on demand)
Cursor rules structure as skills model
strategic_alignment: Human Empowerment - skills encode human expertise
2026 Initiative - Workflow Builder / AI Assistant Tool
hypothesis_candidates: Progressive disclosure scales expertise without context limits

action_items.what: Update composio-agent-framework PRD with skills layer
Define skill vs agent terminology in design system
